util.object

Class Either<L,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.object.Either<L,R>

  • public class Either<L,R>
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds either a value of type L, referred to as the "left value", or a value of type R, referred to as the "right value". Often used in situations where the outcome of a computation can either be some value R (the right, correct value) or some other value L indicating an error condition.

    NOTE. Most of this class is based on the core Haskell API for the Either data type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Applies the given transformation to the to the right value if this is a right value holder to produce a new value holder.
      <T> T either(java.util.function.Function<L,T> left, java.util.function.Function<R,T> right)
      Applies left to the left value if this is a left value holder; otherwise applies right to the right value.
      L getLeft()
      Returns the left value if this is a left value holder; null will be merciless returned if this is instead a right value holder;
      R getRight()
      Returns the right value if this is a right value holder; null will be merciless returned if this is instead a left value holder;
      boolean isLeft()
      Is this a left value holder?
      boolean isRight()
      Is this a right value holder?
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> left(L leftValue)
      Creates a new holder for a left value.
      <T> Either<L,T> map(java.util.function.Function<R,T> f)
      Applies the given transformation to the right value if this is a right value holder to produce a new right value holder to store the result of the transformation.
      <T> Either<T,R> mapLeft(java.util.function.Function<L,T> f)
      Same as map but on left values.
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> right(R rightValue)
      Creates a new holder for a right value.

      • map

        public <T> Either<L,T> map(java.util.function.Function<R,T> f)
        Applies the given transformation to the right value if this is a right value holder to produce a new right value holder to store the result of the transformation. Does nothing if this is a left value holder, just returning a new left value holder containing this left value; this way a left value is propagated as is through map calls.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the mapped type.
        Parameters:
        f - the transformation to apply to the right value.
        Returns:
        a new right value holder with the mapped value if this is a right value holder; otherwise a new left value holder with this object's left value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if this is a right value holder and the argument is null.

      • mapLeft

        public <T> Either<T,R> mapLeft(java.util.function.Function<L,T> f)
        Same as map but on left values.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the mapped type.
        Parameters:
        f - the left value mapper.
        Returns:
        a new left value holder with the mapped value if this is a left value holder; otherwise a new right value holder with this object's right value.

      • bind

        public <T> Either<L,T> bind(java.util.function.Function<R,Either<L,T>> f)
        Applies the given transformation to the to the right value if this is a right value holder to produce a new value holder. Does nothing if this is a left value holder, just returning a new left value holder containing this left value; this way a left value is propagated as is through map calls.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the mapped type.
        Parameters:
        f - the new value holder producer to apply to the right value.
        Returns:
        the result of applying f to the right value if this is a right value holder; otherwise a new left value holder with this object's left value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if this is a right value holder and the argument is null.

      • either

        public <T> T either(java.util.function.Function<L,T> left,
                    java.util.function.Function<R,T> right)
        Applies left to the left value if this is a left value holder; otherwise applies right to the right value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the mapped type.
        Parameters:
        left - the transformation to apply to the left value.
        right - the transformation to apply to the right value.
        Returns:
        the result of applying either transformation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
